author: @averyscott7504
text: These videos are great.  So many other tutorials assume a base set of knowledge but you're doing an excellent job of explaining things from the start.  I have a couple of questions.  My apologies in advance if you're covering them in a different video:  1) I'm guessing you want to normalize your features/dimensions so a single dimension with a big difference doesn't dominate the total distance between two points.  Is that right?  2) If (1) is correct, is there a type of "training" you can do to normalize each dimension differently?  I realize this is contrary to the meaning of normalize, but I was just thinking of it as a way of weighting a certain feature more than others.  For example, if you had 3 features, and you guessed that Feature 2 was twice as important as Feature 1 and Feature 3, your min-max range vector for the 3 features could be something like [0-1, 0-2, 0-1] respectively.
